evidence.text: 1 | 2025-04-02 | COMPLAINT For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief against All Defendants Filing fee: $ 405, receipt number AMADC-10928559 (Fee Status: Filing Fee paid), filed by American Public Health Association, Ibis Reproductive Health, United Auto Workers, Brittany Charlton, Katie Edwards, Peter Lurie, Nicole Maphis.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief on April 2, 2025, seeking to challenge government policies related to health regulations.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Preliminary Injunction on April 25, 2025, seeking an order to prevent defendants from implementing certain directives related to NIH policies.

evidence.text: 39 | 2025-04-25 | MOTION for Protective Order Regarding Certain Organizational Declarants by American Public Health Association, Ibis Reproductive Health, United Auto Workers, Brittany Charlton, Katie Edwards, Peter Lurie, Nicole Maphis. add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Protective Order on April 25, 2025, seeking restrictions on disclosure of sensitive organizational information.

evidence.text: 33 | 2025-04-23 | MOTION to Seal by American Public Health Association, Ibis Reproductive Health, United Auto Workers, Brittany Charlton, Katie Edwards, Peter Lurie, Nicole Maphis.(Schlossberg, Suzanne) (Entered: 04/23/2025)
evidence.source_document: Docket

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion to Seal on April 23, 2025, seeking to file certain documents under seal due to sensitive content.

evidence.text: 36 | 2025-04-24 | Judge Brian E. Murphy: ELECTRONIC ORDER entered granting 33 Motion to Seal. Counsel will receive an email within twenty-four (24) hours of this order with instructions for submitting sealed documents for which leave has been granted in accordance with the Local Rules of the U.S. District Court of Massachusetts.
evidence.source_document: Docket

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Motion to Seal on April 24, 2025, allowing plaintiffs to file sealed documents under specific procedures.

evidence.text: 63 | 2025-05-06 | Judge William G. Young ORDER entered: PROTECTIVE ORDER Regarding Certain Organizational Declarants. (MAP) (Entered: 05/06/2025)
evidence.source_document: Docket

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Motion for Protective Order on May 6, 2025, establishing terms for handling sensitive organizational information.

add_extracted.value: Appeal: National Institutes of Health, Jay Bhattacharya, United States Department of Health and Human Services, Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. appealed to US Court of Appeals

evidence.text: Electronic Clerk's Notes for proceedings held before Judge William G. Young: Bench Trial as to Phase 1 held on 6/16/2025.Court hears argument on Phase 1 of the case. Defendants ask Court to take Judicial Notice of the Federal Register Notices. Court takes Judicial Notice. Defendants move to admit into evidence 13 Certified records. No objection. Admitted as exhibit 1. Court takes the matter under advisement. Parties will inform the Court if they wish for the Court to reconvene in the afternoon or if they wish for the Court to hold off issuing a ruling as to Phase 1. The Court reconvenes in the afternoon. The Court announces the findings and rulings that it is able to make today. The challenged directives are vacated. A written order will issue. Defendants shall promptly comply with the order of the Court.
evidence.source_document: Docket

add_extracted.value: Bench trial held on June 16, 2025, as to Phase 1 of the case, resulting in the court vacating the challenged directives and issuing a partial final judgment
